intro: Styrax ferrugineus var. grandifolius, commonly known as the large-leaved styrax, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to China. It is characterized by its glossy, ovate leaves that are typically 5–10 cm in length and have a reddish or purplish hue when young. The plant produces fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers in clustered inflorescences, which appear in late spring to early summer. Its bark is smooth and reddish-brown, and it is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens. The species is relatively hardy and prefers well-drained soil in full sun to partial shade.
